page.title: 14ST.BARTHOLOMEWS LOWESWATER
page.content: This is the only Loweswater building used for regular worship. A special feature of the church is the clear glass East window installed 1974 in memory of Lady Balogh. One service is held every Sunday morning, alternating communion, morning prayer & family communion. Congregations average 30 including holiday makers. Both the old prayer and alternative service books are used. In 1984,3 baptisms,1 wedding & a confirmation of eight people took place. Funerals average 6-8 a year. The annual requirement of Â£5000 for expenses is derived from collections, covenants, a garden fete & a whist drive. The 1984 centenary was celebrated by: A Flower Festival, donations & other events raising over Â£24000 to refurbish the Church.The Loweswater Vicarage is the residence of the united benefice.
